discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"√(2016% × 2016)
We convert 2016% into 20.16
From the given:
√(2016% × 2016) = √(20.16 × 2016)
= √(40642.56)
= 201.6
So, the answer is 201.6."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

comments.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Why did u multiplied it.You could take 2016 out.Like√(2016*2016/100)=2016√(1/100)

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

title: 2016 problem!

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                    "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Relevant wiki: Function Problem Solving","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Consider the following:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\begin{aligned} f(x) + f(1-x) & = \frac 8{16^x+4} + \frac 8{16^{1-x}+4} \\ & = \frac 8{16^x+4} + \frac {8(16^x)}{16+4(16^x)} \\ & = \frac 8{16^x+4} + \frac {2(16^x)}{4+16^x} \\ & = \frac {8+2(16^x)}{16^x+4} \\ & = 2 \end{aligned} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now, let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x = \dfrac n{2016}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", where "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is a positive integer, then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1-x = \dfrac {2016-n}{2016} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".  Therefore, the expression:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\begin{aligned} \sum_{n=1}^{2016} f\left(\frac n{2016}\right) & = \sum_{n=1}^{1007} \left[ f\left(\frac n{2016}\right) + f\left(1 - \frac n{2016}\right) \right] + f\left(\frac {1008}{2016}\right) + f\left(\frac {2016}{2016}\right) \\ & = 2(1007) + \frac 8{16^\frac 12 +4} +  \frac 8{16^1+4} \\ & = 2014 + 1 + 0.4 = \boxed{2015.400} \end{aligned} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

comments.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Oh that's beautiful!"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"I started by approximating the answer by integrating the function from 0 to 1, and got exactly 2016. That is kind of neat, but not what was wanted!

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            My answer came out to be 2016.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" f \left ( \dfrac x {2016}\right )+f \left (\dfrac{2016-x}{2016}\right )=8 \left \{   \dfrac 1 {16^{\frac x {2016}}+4}+\dfrac 1 {16^{\frac {2016 - x} {2016}}+4} \right \}=2.\\    "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
  \displaystyle   \sum_{x=1}^{1007} \left \{ f \left ( \dfrac x {2016}\right )+f \left (\dfrac{2016-x}{2016}\right ) \right \}+ f \left ( \dfrac {1008} {2016} \right )+ f \left ( \dfrac {2016 }{2016}\right )\\   "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
=2014+1+\frac 2 5=\huge  \ \ \ \color{#D61F06}{2015.400}.\\   "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}
